headline: 'Gambler' Trump is going against advisers by endorsing risky candidates like Dr. Oz and JD Vance, report says
author: Alia Shoaib
sentences: "The biggest way to defeat him is to electorally chip away at the notion he is the most powerful endorsement in the country," Alyssa Farah Griffin, a former Trump White House communications director turned critic, told The Post.

The former president has been on an endorsement spree ahead of the November elections, backing hundreds of candidates for various positions, often simply because they support his election fraud claims, the paper said.
Some advisers fear that he is diluting the power of his endorsement and that if his desired candidates don't win, it will jeopardize his image as Republican kingmaker, sources told The Post.
Former President Donald Trump is going against advisers by endorsing risky candidates such as Dr. Mehmet Oz and JD Vance in competitive GOP primaries, sources told The Washington Post.
